intro: Meliosma fordii var. fordii, commonly known as the Chinese ironwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in late spring, followed by dark blue berries that are edible for birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
